conclusion: Analyze refraction of light using Snell's Law and geometry to find refractive index.
Semi-cylindrical object with radius R; light enters along axis OA to point C at distance sqrt(3)/3 R from O.
Angle of incidence at point A is 0 degrees; light travels straight to point B on curved surface.
Calculate OB using Pythagorean theorem: OB = 2R/sqrt(3).
Perpendicular distance from B to vertical line through O is R.
Angle of incidence at point B is 60 degrees.
Using Snell's Law, n1 sin 60 degrees = 1 sin 90 degrees.
Refractive index of the transparent object is 2sqrt(3)/3.
